item.title: Shopify 预测第三季度营收高于预期
item.description: 尽管关税相关的不确定性给零售企业带来了压力，但由于其人工智能功能和平台升级促进了对其电子商务服务的需求，Shopify , 周三预计第三季度营收将高于市场预期。【原文：Shopify , forecast third-quarter revenue above market estimates on Wednesday, as its AI features and platform upgrades boosted demand for its e-commerce services despite tariff-related uncertainty pressuring retail businesses.】

item.title: 优步押注忠诚度计划以推动增长，并公布 200 亿美元回购计划
item.description: 优步（Uber）周三公布了一项价值 200 亿美元的股票回购计划，并预测其第三季度预订额将高于华尔街预期，因为这家打车和快递服务公司正受益于其付费会员计划的日益普及。【原文：Uber unveiled a $20 billion stock buyback program and forecast its third-quarter bookings above Wall Street estimates on Wednesday, as the ride-hailing and delivery services company benefits from growing adoption of its paid loyalty program.】

item.title: 迈克尔-科尔斯（Michael Kors）的所有者卡普里公布的收入降幅小于预期
item.description: 卡普里控股公司（Capri Holdings）周三公布的季度营收降幅小于预期，这主要得益于尽管零售业整体放缓，但市场对 Michael Kors 旗下奢侈手袋和鞋类产品的需求仍有所增长。【原文：Capri Holdings posted a smaller-than-expected drop in quarterly revenue on Wednesday, helped by improving demand for the Michael Kors owner's luxury handbags and footwear despite a broader retail slowdown.】

item.title: 迪斯尼凭借流媒体业务收益超出预期，并上调了业绩指引
item.description: 华特迪士尼（Walt Disney）周三公布的 4 月至 6 月业绩好于预期，并上调了全年盈利指引，原因是该公司的流媒体电视利润增长，而且美国主题公园游客增加了消费。【原文：Walt Disney posted better-than-expected results for April through June and raised its full-year earnings guidance on Wednesday as the company's streaming television profit grew and U.S. theme park visitors increased their spending.】

item.title: 格伦科尔拒绝在美国上市，推动英国市场发展
item.description: 格伦科尔公司将继续在伦敦上市，暂时拒绝迁往美国，这对伦敦市场来说是一次难得的胜利，由于缺乏新股发行，伦敦市场一直在萎缩。【原文：Glencore will keep its primary listing in London, rejecting a move to the United States for now in a rare win for the city's markets, which have been shrinking due to a dearth of new share issues.】

item.title: 匈牙利的里希特说，美国的一些出口产品面临关税挑战，但旗舰药物可免征关税
item.description: 匈牙利制药公司里克特首席执行官加博尔-奥尔班（Gabor Orban）周三表示，美国提高关税可能会使该公司向美国出口部分产品面临挑战，但不会对其旗舰抗精神病药物Vraylar征收关税。【原文：Higher U.S. tariffs may make it challenging for Hungarian pharmaceutical company Richter to export some products to the United States, but they won't apply to its flagship antipsychotic drug Vraylar, CEO Gabor Orban said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 华尔街期货在美联储降息的乐观情绪中上扬；盈利成为焦点
item.description: 美国股指期货周三上涨，原因是市场对美联储今年降息的预期不断增强，同时投资者对新一波企业盈利进行了评估。【原文：U.S. stock index futures rose on Wednesday amid growing expectations of the Federal Reserve's interest rate cuts this year, while investors assessed a new wave of corporate earnings.】

item.title: 华特迪士尼旗下 ESPN 将于 8 月 21 日推出新的流媒体服务
item.description: 沃尔特-迪斯尼公司旗下的 ESPN 周三表示，将于 8 月 21 日推出新的 ESPN 直接面向消费者的流媒体服务，定价为每月 29.99 美元。【原文：Walt Disney's ESPN said on Wednesday it would launch the new ESPN's direct-to-consumer streaming service on August 21, priced at $29.99 per month.】

item.title: 凯雷第二季度利润高于预期，原因是费用增长，资产管理规模攀升
item.description: 凯雷集团（Carlyle Group）周三公布的第二季度利润好于预期，这主要得益于其管理资产的增长带来的费用增加。【原文：Carlyle Group reported a better-than-expected profit in the second quarter on Wednesday, helped by a pickup in fees as it grew its assets under management.】

item.title: 特朗普关税让加拿大小企业蒙受损失，大企业和石油公司却享受豁免待遇
item.description: 史蒂夫-马利亚（Steve Mallia）位于多伦多的望远镜配件业务一直在蓬勃发展，直到今年 3 月，特朗普政府对不符合《美国-墨西哥-加拿大协定》当地含量规定的美国订单征收 25% 的关税。【原文：Steve Mallia's Toronto-based telescope accessory business was thriving until March when the Trump administration imposed a 25% tariff on U.S.-bound orders that do not comply with local content rules under the U.S.-Mexico-Canada Agreement.】

item.title: Bath & Body Works 瞄准大学书店，吸引年轻买家
item.description: Bath & Body Works 要上大学了。【原文：Bath & Body Works is going to college.】

item.title: OpenAI 期待已久的 GPT-5 模型即将发布
item.description: OpenAI 的 GPT-5 是 2022 年推动 ChatGPT 巨浪的人工智能技术的最新版本，即将发布，用户将仔细研究 GPT-4 的升级是否与研究实验室之前的改进相当。【原文：OpenAI's GPT-5, the latest installment of the AI technology that powered the ChatGPT juggernaut in 2022, is set for an imminent release, and users will scrutinize if the step up from GPT-4 is on par with the research lab's previous improvements.】

item.title: 印度与华盛顿紧张关系加剧，美国640亿美元出口将受冲击
item.description: 四位消息人士援引政府的一份内部评估报告告诉路透社，由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普征收25%的关税以及假定购买俄罗斯石油将受到10%的惩罚，印度预计将在出口到美国的价值约640亿美元的商品中失去竞争优势。【原文：India expects to lose a competitive advantage in about $64 billion worth of goods exported to the U.S. due to President Donald Trump's 25% tariff and an assumed 10% penalty for buying Russian oil, four sources told Reuters citing an internal assessment report by the government.】

item.title: 西门子能源计划削减成本，提高海上风电机组产量，以实现收支平衡
item.description: 西门子能源公司高管周三在公布季度业绩后对分析师表示，西门子能源公司将依靠进一步削减成本和不断加强海上风电活动来实现其亏损的西门子歌美飒（Siemens Gamesa）部门收支平衡的目标。【原文：Siemens Energy is banking on further cost cuts and an ongoing ramp-up of offshore wind activities to meet its goal of breaking even at its loss-making Siemens Gamesa unit, executives told analysts on Wednesday after presenting quarterly results.】

item.title: 数据中心业绩不佳，人工智能押注受挫，AMD、超微股价下滑
item.description: 芯片公司先进微设备公司（Advanced Micro Devices）和服务器制造商超微计算机公司（Super Micro Computer）的股价在周三的盘前交易中暴跌，原因是这两家公司公布的数据中心部门业绩令人失望，动摇了投资者对其人工智能增长前景的信心。【原文：Shares of chip company Advanced Micro Devices and server maker Super Micro Computer tumbled in premarket trading on Wednesday after the companies posted underwhelming results in their data center segments, shaking investor confidence in their AI growth narratives.】

item.title: 广告故障、激烈竞争阻碍增长，Snap 下挫
item.description: Snap股价在周三的盘前交易中暴跌近17%，原因是疲软的季度业绩和日益加剧的竞争凸显了该公司在追赶人工智能驱动的同行方面所面临的困境。【原文：Snap shares plummeted nearly 17% in premarket trading on Wednesday as a weak quarter and mounting competition underscored the company's struggle to keep pace with AI-driven peers.】

item.title: 萨瓦德尔（Sabadell）股东批准将其英国子公司 TSB 出售给桑坦德银行
item.description: Sabadell 股东周三一致批准将其英国业务部门 TSB 出售给桑坦德银行，这被视为一项防御性举措，因为 Sabadell 试图阻止 BBVA 约 150 亿欧元（173.6 亿美元）的恶意收购要约。【原文：Sabadell shareholders on Wednesday unanimously approved the sale of its British unit TSB to Santander in what is seen as a defensive move as it seeks to stop BBVA's around 15 billion euro ($17.36 billion) hostile takeover bid.】

item.title: 独家报道美国议员在致公司董事会主席的信中质疑英特尔首席执行官与中国的关系
item.description: 美国共和党参议员汤姆-科顿（Tom Cotton）周三致信英特尔董事会主席，就该芯片制造商新任首席执行官谭立武与中国公司的关系以及最近涉及其前公司 Cadence Design 的刑事案件提出质疑。【原文：U.S. Republican Senator Tom Cotton sent a letter to Intel's board chair on Wednesday with questions about the chipmaker's new CEO Lip-Bu Tan's ties to Chinese firms and a recent criminal case involving his former company Cadence Design .】

item.title: 欧元区零售销售额修正后增长快于预期
item.description: 周三的数据显示，欧元区 6 月份零售销售额的增长速度超过了预期，这进一步证实了这样一种观点，即得益于国内消费的持续反弹，欧元区仍能抵御贸易不确定性的影响。【原文：Euro zone retail sales grew quicker than thought in June, data showed on Wednesday, reinforcing views that the bloc remains resilient to trade uncertainty thanks to the continued rebound in domestic consumption.】

item.title: DIHK 发现，近 60% 的德国企业预计欧盟与美国的协议将加重它们的负担
item.description: 周三的一项调查显示，近 60% 的德国公司预计欧盟与美国达成的贸易协议将通过提高关税和增加官僚主义给他们带来更多负担。【原文：Nearly 60% of German companies expect the European Union's trade deal with the United States to create more burdens for them through higher tariffs and more bureaucracy, a survey said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 报告显示，2025 年上半年全球保险巨灾损失达 800 亿美元
item.description: 瑞士再保险研究所周三的初步估计显示，受加利福尼亚州野火和美国严重雷暴的影响，2025 年上半年全球自然灾害保险损失达到 800 亿美元。【原文：Global insured losses from natural catastrophes reached $80 billion in the first half of 2025, preliminary estimates from Swiss Re Institute showed on Wednesday, driven by wildfires in California and severe thunderstorms in the United States.】

item.title: 日本执政党重量级人物警告反对日本央行加息
item.description: 执政党重量级人物齐藤健（Ken Saito）告诉路透社，鉴于美国关税对脆弱经济的预期打击，日本央行必须谨慎对待加息问题。【原文：The Bank of Japan must be cautious about raising interest rates given the expected hit from U.S. tariffs on the fragile economy, ruling party heavyweight Ken Saito told Reuters.】

item.title: 马斯克称 xAI 将开源 Grok 2 聊天机器人
item.description: 亿万富翁埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）周三表示，他的人工智能初创公司xAI将于下周开源其聊天机器人Grok 2。【原文：Billionaire Elon Musk said on Wednesday that his artificial intelligence startup xAI will open source its chatbot Grok 2 next week.】

item.title: Blackstone 将以 34 亿美元将日本 TechnoPro 私有化
item.description: 日本工程师招聘公司 TechnoPro Holdings 周三表示，以美国投资基金 Blackstone 为首的集团将以每股 4,870 日元的价格向 TechnoPro Holdings 发起 5,074 亿日元（约合 34.4 亿美元）的要约收购。【原文：U.S. investment fund Blackstone-led group will launch a 507.4 billion yen ($3.44 billion) tender offer for TechnoPro Holdings at 4,870 yen per share, the Japanese engineer staffing firm said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 本田第一季度营业利润下降 50
item.description: 本田汽车公司周四报告称，由于日元走强和美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的关税影响，该公司第一季度营业利润下降了50%。【原文：Honda Motor reported a 50% drop in first-quarter operating profit on Thursday, as a stronger yen and the impact of U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs took a toll on its results.】

item.title: 德国 6 月工业订单下降 1
item.description: 德国联邦统计局周三表示，德国 6 月份的工业订单有所下降，经季节和日历调整后比上月减少了 1%。【原文：German industrial orders fell in June, declining by 1% on the previous month on a seasonally and calendar adjusted basis, the federal statistics office said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 日本称美国在贸易协定下的投资将取决于东京的利益
item.description: 日本的最高关税谈判代表周二表示，日本在上个月达成的贸易协议中承诺的 5500 亿美元的美国投资将取决于这些投资是否也能使东京受益。【原文：Japan's promised $550 billion in U.S. investments under the trade deal struck last month will be determined by whether they will benefit Tokyo too, the Asian nation's top tariff negotiator said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 拜耳称在重组推进过程中迄今已裁员 12,000 人
item.description: 拜耳公司周三表示，自重组计划启动以来，该公司已削减了约 12000 个全职职位，以加快决策速度并减少管理和行政职位。【原文：Bayer said on Wednesday it had cut about 12,000 full-time positions since the start of a restructuring programme to speed up decision-making and reduce managerial and administrative positions.】

item.title: 受美国关税影响，印尼计划改向中国出售虾类
item.description: 在距离华盛顿特区 16,000 多公里（9,942 英里）的印度尼西亚的一个养虾场，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的进口关税使 Denny Leonardo 的扩张计划陷入困境。【原文：At a shrimp farm in Indonesia, more than 16,000 km (9,942 miles) from Washington D.C., U.S. President Donald Trump's import tariffs have left Denny Leonardo's expansion plans in disarray.】

item.title: 伟哥制造商诺和诺德第二季度销售额增长 18
item.description: Wegovy 制造商诺和诺德公司周三公布的第二季度销售额增长了 18%，低于分析师最初的预期，而上周发布的重大盈利预警和新任首席执行官的宣布使该公司股价损失了约 950 亿美元。【原文：Wegovy-maker Novo Nordisk reported second-quarter sales up 18% on Wednesday, below initial analyst expectations, after a major profit warning and new CEO announcement last week wiped some $95 billion of value from the company's stock.】
